title: When AI Meets Slop
author: Hass Dhia
excerpt: AI-generated content is flooding the internet with plausible-sounding nonsense. As trust erodes, brands that double down on authentic local connections will win.

sources.title: Welcome to the Age of Travel Slop
Doubting Your Doubts Can Boost Motivation

linkedinOrgTeaser:
NEW ON THE BLOG: Tourists are showing up in Peru looking for AI-invented canyons that don't exist. Trust in AI trip planning dropped from 47% to 34% among young Americans. The slop problem isn't just annoying - it's reshaping how consumers evaluate authenticity. For brands, this creates an unexpected opportunity.

#BrandActivation #AI #ConsumerTrust #LocalPartnership
linkedinPersonalTeaser:
Merriam-Webster picked 'slop' as the word of 2025.

Not because we're eating more of it. Because AI is producing plausible-sounding nonsense at industrial scale.

Tourists are hiking to fictional canyons. Restaurants are getting labeled with the wrong dietary restrictions. Young Americans' trust in AI trip planning dropped from 47% to 34% in a year.

But here's the counterintuitive thing: research shows that when people doubt their doubts, they actually commit harder to what matters.

Maybe the slop era makes authenticity more valuable, not less.

What do you think - does AI content make you trust human recommendations more?
